US dollars October 12 is world sight day
on this occasion to raise
people's awareness about blindness. The central eye hospital
organized a seminar yesterday
afternoon with notable information:  Vietnam
currently has about 2 million blind people and
80 of these diseases are
preventable, according to experts. Among the
main causes of blindness today,
cataract accounts for 66.1 cases, followed
by other diseases.  fundus disease,
glaucoma, refractive errors, etc. Notably, refractive errors
are increasingly common among
adolescents with an eye rate of about 15 to
20 PH in rural students, 30 to 40 PH
in cities.  Glasses for
children with refractive errors such as nearsightedness and
astigmatism are one of the
least expensive and most effective intervention measures to
reduce the rate of compensation, however this still
faces many barriers in people's awareness.  According to statistics,
occupational accidents causing eye injuries account
for more than 1/3 of the total number of injuries. 89
cases of eyeball injuries
occur while working and without
proper protective eyewear.
This year's World Sight Day is aimed at eye safety
at work, emphasizing the importance of
eye protection during work
and calling on employers to
prioritize eye care for workers of
all ages.  anytime,

Many of the fireworks were confirmed to be fake

Yesterday, the first group of Brazilian citizens
returned to the country after the
outbreak of war in Israel. And they
shared about this unfamiliar experience.
Miss Rosal Pera can now breathe.
relieved to be reunited with my family
after the rescue flight from Israel to
Brazil. It was scary, you didn't know
what would happen in the next few minutes, the
streets were deserted and we
anxiously waited for the bus to arrive.  Cu Pereira
is among the first group of Brazilian citizens
to return to the country. To date, the
country's government has made efforts to bring more than 2,000 citizens
back, but many tourists and
people from other countries are still stuck in the
surrounding area.  suddenly and was very restless and worried.

pal A recent study shows that
half of future medicines will no
longer be available because nearly half of the
world's plant species are or are at
risk of extinction, even
millions of plant species have not yet been discovered.  Identified plants
have a higher chance of extinction.
British scientists have just issued
this serious warning in a recent report.
Scientists predict that more than 75 PH
of unidentified plant species
are threatened.  Threat of extinction Besides,
about 45 types of flowering plants are at
risk of extinction. They believe that the
real number may be even higher and in the next 5 years
that rate may be even higher.
Scientists also emphasize  Strongly believe that
without plants, humans will also be ruined.
Think about Vietnam. Half of the medicines
in the future will no longer be

extinct, that is the level of threat and the
level of  The impact it could have on
humans in the future about 2,000

climate is considered a threat to the

their habitat needs to be a
global priority. Video games have always been a challenge
for people with disabilities.  However,
Sony has designed a new product
to change that with the support of
disabled gamers.
With the controllers of Gaming devices
such as PlayStation Xbox or Nintendo,
disabled people may have difficulty
or  It's not even possible to control
it, but that doesn't mean
the fun of playing the game will disappear. This is
Sony's new device called the access
controller. It includes a lever
connected to a circular button cluster.
Everything on this device can be
disassembled and customized to suit the
user. The team designed the
device to fit on a table or
wheelchair, and gamers with disabilities
collaborated with Sony.  to develop
this product since 2018. The device is expected
to be sold later this year for
